intro: Gastrolobium pultenaeum, commonly known as the Pultenaea bush, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. Gastrolobium pultenaeum is often found in heathlands and woodland areas, contributing to local biodiversity.
